Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Goblet
Description: Goblet that was misshapen before firing and crudely manufactured. Several examples were found in a rock-cut tomb. The vessel is tall, with an ovoid bottom and a wide orifice ending with a simple lip in continuation of the body. The clay is fine, micaceous, orange and polished. Two white stripes adorn the rim and the middle of the body.
